user_request: A Father's Day poem about a dad being a hero and role model.
final_poem:
In fields of green where whispers play,
And rivers sing beneath the sky,
My father stands with gentle sway,
A lighthouse bright, come what may.

With hands that work both day and night,
He crafts a path so smooth and clear.
Through storms and winds, through joy and flight,
His presence is my greatest treasure here.

By moonlight's glow or sunlit glare,
He shows the way to honor life.
In every task he gently shares
The strength of heart and soul to thrive.

A hero in his own right,
Not just a dad by name alone.
With quiet dignity, he fights
For what’s best, where others roam.

So on this day I raise my voice,
To celebrate him with all my might.
My father, who's more than just a choice—
A guiding light, the one true fight.
